text: The inflammasomes and their respective activators examined in this study are listed in Table 1 .
Cells were stimulated in accordance with the schedule in Figure 1 .
In CF , airway epithelial cells have been shown to possess a hyper-inflammatory phenotype and produce an exaggerated pro-inflammatory cytokine response [ 4 ] , [ 5 ] .

To determine if airway epithelial cells contribute to the increased <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production in patients with CF , CF and control bronchial epithelial cell lines were stimulated with the inflammasome inducers P . aeruginosa strain PAO1 ( PAO1 ) and LPS followed by ATP .

text: <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels in cell culture supernatants were not greatly increased in either the CF or control cell lines ( Fig . 2a-d ) , although a small increase in <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production was detected in NuLi-1 and CuFi-1 cells , but not in S9 and IB3-1 cells , by 24 hours .

text: In contrast , these airway cells were highly responsive to other inflammatory stimuli , such as recombinant <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , producing large quantities of IL-8 ( Fig . 2a-d inserts ) .
